title: Creating a reading list of articles on machine reasoning and interpretable neural networks involves selecting influential and foundational papers that have contributed significantly to these fields. Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2020 that you might find useful
**"A Survey of Machine Reasoning"** - This paper provides an overview of the various approaches and techniques in machine reasoning
**"Neural-Symbolic Learning and Reasoning: A Survey and Interpretation"**
This paper discusses the integration of neural networks with symbolic reasoning

author.literal: **"Differentiable Inductive Logic Programming"** - Evans, R., & Grefenstette, E.

title: This paper introduces a differentiable approach to inductive logic programming

author.literal: **"Neural Theorem Provers"** - Rockt√§schel, T., & Riedel, S.

title: This work presents a neural network model for automated theorem proving

author.literal: **"End-to-End Differentiable Proving"** - Manhaeve, R., Dumancic, S., Kimmig, A., Demeester, T., & De Raedt, L.

title: This paper explores differentiable proving in neural-symbolic systems

author.literal: **"Learning to Explain: An Information-Theoretic Perspective on Model Interpretation"** - Chen, J., Song, L., Wainwright, M. J., & Jordan, M. I.

title: This paper discusses interpretability in the context of machine reasoning

author.literal: **"Neural Logic Machines"** - Dong, H., Mao, J., Lin, T., Wang, C., Li, L., & Zhou, D.

title: This paper introduces a neural architecture for logical reasoning
**"Graph Neural Networks: A Review of Methods and Applications"**
This review covers graph neural networks, which are crucial for reasoning over structured data

author.literal: **"Relational Inductive Biases, Deep Learning, and Graph Networks"** - Battaglia, P. W., Hamrick, J. B., Bapst, V., Sanchez-Gonzalez, A., Zambaldi, V., Malinowski, M., ... & Pascanu, R.

title: This paper discusses the importance of relational inductive biases in reasoning

author.literal: **"Compositional Attention Networks for Machine Reasoning"** - Hudson, D. A., & Manning, C. D.

title: This paper presents a model for reasoning using compositional attention mechanisms
**"Interpretable Machine Learning: A Guide for Making Black Box Models Explainable"**
This book provides a comprehensive guide to interpretability techniques

author.literal: **"Attention is All You Need"** - Vaswani, A., Shazeer, N., Parmar, N., Uszkoreit, J., Jones, L., Gomez, A. N., ... & Polosukhin, I.

title: While primarily about transformers, this paper has implications for interpretability through attention mechanisms

author.literal: **"LIME: Local Interpretable Model-Agnostic Explanations"** - Ribeiro, M. T., Singh, S., & Guestrin, C.

title: This paper introduces LIME, a popular method for explaining model predictions

author.literal: **"The Building Blocks of Interpretability"** - Olah, C., Satyanarayan, A., Johnson, I., Carter, S., Schubert, L., Ye, K., & Mordvintsev, A.

title: This work explores the components that contribute to model interpretability
**"DeepLIFT: Learning Important Features Through Propagating Activation Differences"**
This paper presents DeepLIFT, a method for attributing the output of neural networks to their input features

author.literal: **"Axiomatic Attribution for Deep Networks"** - Sundararajan, M., Taly, A., & Yan, Q.

title: This paper introduces Integrated Gradients, a method for attributing the predictions of deep networks
**"Explaining Explanations: Axiomatic Feature Interactions for Deep Networks"**
This paper discusses feature interaction explanations for deep networks
**"Towards a Rigorous Science of Interpretable Machine Learning"**
This paper outlines the challenges and future directions for interpretable machine learning

author.literal: **"Visualizing and Understanding Convolutional Networks"** - Zeiler, M. D., & Fergus, R.

title: This paper is foundational in the field of visualizing neural network activations

author.literal: **"The Mythos of Model Interpretability"** - Lipton, Z. C.

title: This paper critically examines the concept of interpretability in machine learning
These articles cover a range of topics within machine reasoning and interpretable neural networks, providing a solid foundation for understanding these complex and rapidly evolving fields
